body_html:
Thanks Carmezim for your tip.
I have already run the script and its results are a bit confusing for me.
This is what I got:

ERROR: Failed to import the TensorFlow module.

  • Python version is 3.5.

  • TensorFlow is installed at: C:\Users\Adam\Anaconda3\envs\tensorflow\lib\site-packages\tensorflow

  • Could not load 'cudart64_80.dll'. The GPU version of TensorFlow
    requires that this DLL be installed in a directory that is named in
    your %PATH% environment variable. Download and install CUDA 8.0 from
    this URL: https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit

First of all I have installed CUDA 9 with cuDNN7, I am not sure why tensorflow is looking for the older version.
Second, during the tensorflow-gpu installation I remeber that CUDA8 was also installed. Nevertheless, I tried to dowlad it from the website again but it seems to no longer be available/distributed.

Do you think I should try to get CUDA8 or I can somehow fix this issue having CUDA9?

body:
Thanks Carmezim for your tip. 
I have already run the script and its results are a bit confusing for me.
This is what I got:

ERROR: Failed to import the TensorFlow module.

- Python version is 3.5.

- TensorFlow is installed at: C:\Users\Adam\Anaconda3\envs\tensorflow\lib\site-packages\tensorflow

- Could not load 'cudart64_80.dll'. The GPU version of TensorFlow
  requires that this DLL be installed in a directory that is named in
  your %PATH% environment variable. Download and install CUDA 8.0 from
  this URL: https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit

First of all I have installed CUDA 9 with cuDNN7, I am not sure why tensorflow is looking for the older version.
Second, during the tensorflow-gpu installation I remeber that CUDA8 was also installed. Nevertheless, I tried to dowlad it from the website again but it seems to no longer be available/distributed.

Do you think I should try to get CUDA8 or I can somehow fix this issue having CUDA9?
